snippet: Two organizations dedicated to detecting and curing breast cancer have found themselves on opposite sides of the nation’s divisive debate over abortion.
abstract: Susan G Komen for the Cure foundation decision to cut off financing to Planned Parenthood for breast cancer screening has lit a fierce controversy that threatens to undermine one of the most successful advocacy campaigns in the country; Komen foundation attempted to quietly withdraw its funding from Planned Parenthood, the nation's largest abortion provider, in order to appease conservative women and religious groups.

byline.original: By GARDINER HARRIS and PAM BELLUCK
byline.contributor: Douglas Quenqua and Laurie Goodstein contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Two organizations dedicated to detecting and curing breast cancer have found themselves on opposite sides of the nation’s divisive debate over abortion.

headline.seo: Uproar as Komen Foundation Cuts Money to Planned Parenthood
headline.main: Uproar as Breast Cancer Group Ends Partnership With Planned Parenthood
headline.print_headline: Uproar as Breast Cancer Group Ends Partnership With Planned Parenthood

keywords.value: Komen, Susan G, for the Cure
keywords.name: organizations
